H0.text: Atoms have built up on Roberto's body after he slid down a plastic slide and reached the ground, causing the small electric shock when he touches a piece of metal.

H1.text: Electrons have been built up on Roberto’s body after he slides down the plastic slide, causing the small electric shock he feels when he touches metal.

H2.text: Neutrons have built up on Roberto’s body, causing the small electric shock he feels when he touches a piece of metal after sliding down a plastic slide to the ground.

H3.text: Protons have built up on Roberto’s body, causing the electric shock he feels when he touches a piece of metal after sliding down a plastic slide.

A4.text: Electrons or ions can be exchanged between materials on contact or when they slide against each other.

A5.text: The feeling of an electric shock is caused by the stimulation of nerves as the current flows through the human body.
